Description:
Your Dream Location on 2 Acres
Why wait for another allotment to come along, when this is what you have been searching for ?
Zoned Low Density Residential, this can be used for your home location now, or land bank for future development.
This is your opportunity to secure a fantastic semi-rural parcel of land in the ever-growing suburb of Epsom.
This cleared allotment has services available including town water, phone and power.
With the convenience of a local train station, shopping centres and sporting grounds this land is perfectly positioned to allow flexibility when designing your family home.

Description:
Exceptional Value Townhouse In A Quiet Location
This property located on a block with three townhouses represents a great opportunity for investors or owner occupiers.
Close to sporting amenities, schools, Eaglehawk and a short drive to Bendigo CBD, this three bedroom townhouse offers a great location and the added value of exceptional rental return on investment.
The open plan living gives a sense of space overlooking the reserve behind, with the kitchen boasting quality appliances, island kitchen bench and plenty of room to cook and entertain. Other features of this home include three spacious bedrooms, main with large ensuite and walk in robe. The remaining two bedrooms both have built in robes and are both generous in size with a central bathroom.
Set on a low maintenance allotment this property provides an easy living option for investor, tenant or owner occupier to enjoy their own quiet space, or jump at the opportunity to take a walk through the reserve. The single lock up garage with internal access to the home provides security, and there's additional parking space.
Be quick to inspect this great investment opportunity or first home.

Description:
FAMILY HOMESTEAD ON 50 ACRES JUST 15 MINUTES FROM CITY
If enjoying the rural dream with space both inside and out for all family members is what you are seeking, this property is just what you are looking for. Immaculately presented, the spacious homestead is set in the heart of 50 acres (approx.) of fertile land that is ideal for animals or hobby farming.
The sweeping driveway and wide verandah provides a stunning entrance to the sandstone build, and the wide entry hall leads to living on one side of the house, and bedrooms on the other. There are five bedrooms in total one currently serving as a study with a modified built-in robe providing a study nook and the master features a large walk-through robe, spacious ensuite with corner spa, double vanity, walk-in shower and separate toilet. The family bathroom also features a walk-in shower and a separate powder room and toilet ensure the practical floorplan works for family and guests. The remaining three bedrooms, two with built-in robes and one with walk-in robe, are at the rear of the property and share a fantastic third living area.
A formal lounge is a great escape at the front of the house and beyond this room is a large open plan kitchen, dining and living space. The contemporary country-style kitchen offers ample storage, including a walk-in butlers pantry, and a solid fuel heater to warm the heart of the home. Also off the kitchen is a spacious laundry, linen closet, separate toilet and secure access to the double garage.
Glass sliding doors from the dining room, laundry and the third living space all open out to a large central alfresco area absolutely perfect for entertaining. This paved area includes ceiling fans, lights and power and overlooks the inground swimming pool. The fenced area makes the perfect space to keep an eye on the kids and beyond this area is a fantastic shed, quality fencing dividing the land in to practical paddocks, tanks, dam, woodshed and more.
Additional features include:
- Ducted evaporative cooling
- Ceiling fans throughout and wood burner heating in main living
- Quality kitchen appliances including double wall oven, five-burner gas cooktop and integrated dishwasher
- Pelmets and quality curtains throughout
- Ample storage
- 11 x 22m shed with additional open bays
- 4 x 128,000l water tanks
- Inground swimming pool
- Dam
- Specialty horse fencing on some paddocks
- Seasonal creek runs through the property
With expansive land offering dedicated horse paddocks, fantastic outbuildings and a beautiful and spacious family home, this wonderful property truly offers an idyllic country lifestyle for a horse-lover or hobby farmer. With all amenities just down the road, this is a home that offers the very best of both city convenience and country beauty.

Description:
Titled 832sqm Allotment. Your chance to capitalise on the $25,000 HomeBuilder Grant!
The announcement of the Australian Government's $25,000 HomeBuilder Grant has piqued the interest of more than a few future home builders.
The grant provides first and subsequent home builders with $25,000 to build a new home, where building contracts are signed between 4 June 2020 and 31 December 2020, construction commences within three months of the building contract date, and the total house and land price does not exceed $750,000.
13 Lillie Lane, Strathdale, a spacious 832sqm block with all services in place, prestigious positioning and most importantly an issued title, is sure to be immensely appealing.
This stunning allotment is located at the top of one of Strathdale's boutique streets and is perfectly suited for a large family home, complete with garden, swimming pool and elevated decks to take advantage of the commanding views both front and rear.
Positioned amongst high quality established homes and only minutes to Kennington Reservoir, supermarkets, schools and cafes.
If you want to avoid delays with the titles office and the slow paperwork that comes with big developers, take a look at this property. The vendors are as motivated to sell as you are to buy a block and build.

Description:
Central Charm. Own a part of Bendigo's fantastic history
Centrally located this charming period home has so much to offer. Only minutes from the CBD, Girton College, St John of God Hospital and not too far from the Bendigo Hospital, this property is ideal for the owner occupier or investor. Features include 3 bedrooms, 2 formal living rooms, gas log fire and reverse cycle air-conditioner in the lounge, large kitchen meals with gas cooking, walk in pantry and gas heating, bathroom and good size laundry. From inside to out the home has undercover outdoor entertaining that extends the rear of the home, and good size garage. Enjoy the position, walk everywhere and utilise all that beautiful Bendigo has to offer.
A little history
Honeysuckle Street is one of several streets laid out in c1854 to be given a "Floral" name. The owner builder of this home was John McCraw, a "miner' from Scotland and the home was built around c1873. John was first mate onboard the ship "Omega" when it sailed from Plymoth on 29th May 1852. (John was 26 years of age). On board the ship was Isabella Sneddon (19 years of age) and other members of her family. John and Isabella were married in 1853 in South Australia and moved to Victoria in 1854. Records have them living in a frame tenement and canvas tent with 6 children in the Honeysuckle Street location up until they purchased the lot at Auction on the 15th May 1871 and commenced building the house. They eventually had a family of 10 children. The house was passed down through the family until sold in 1992.
Insights: 50 Honeysuckle Street, Bendigo VIC 3550 was last sold in 1992 and 81 other 3 bedroom house in Bendigo have recently been sold.

Address: Lot 114 Hemley Circuit Maiden Gully VIC 3551
Description:
Westbury Estate - Stage 6
Comprising of 24 lots ranging from 608m2 to 871m2. Westbury will certainly be catering to the growing family with wider, deeper lots providing plenty of space for the larger home, a shed (man cave), or a pool.
Westbury Estate, a beautifully elevated boutique estate, located on the corner of the Calder Highway & Sparrowhawk Road in Bendigo is only 5kms from the Bendigo CBD. It is within walking distance to the Bendigo Stadium and is also only 3kms from the schools and facilities of Maiden Gully and Golden Square and only 8kms from Kangaroo Flat. It really is at the heart of all of Bendigos city and outer suburbs facilities. A fabulous location for a new Villawood Community.
With a Shine Bright Early Learning and Health Hub in the centre of the community, this is the perfect spot to bring up your family. Shine Bright is a not for profit community based organisation that operates with the needs of children and families as its highest priority.

Description:
The perfect size - in a Great Location
In a coveted location, this large Battle-Axe block is ideal!
NOTE: the vendors are after a quick sale - price has been adjusted - now great value at $175,000. Zoned rural residential, the size is a generous 1082 m2 with a very wide 'axe-handle' entry of 6 metres approx allowing for the possibility of a lovely entry to be created with perhaps a wonderful line of trees and garden beds and still leaving a driveway of a generous width.
This great, family sized block is near level and gives numerous possibilities regarding house site selection with excellent North orientation as the block does not have any easements to restrict use.
All services are readily available to this block.
The location is terrific, only 2 minutes approx to so much - including Strathfieldsaye shops, local Pub, Sports Ground - Football, Netball and Cricket clubs, Primary School, Regant Park playground, and Early Learning Centre - and is just a handy 6 minutes approx to Strath Village Shopping Centre, Aldi, High school and Uni.
With convenient buses running regularly to and from Bendigo CBD, travel options are easy. This is a lifestyle block to give you the best of all worlds!

A new boutique lifestyle awaits you at Imagine Strathfieldsaye. Choose from a wide selection of quality home and land packages or simply find the perfect block to suit the home of your dreams.
Imagine Strathfieldsayes prestigious address is only a few minutes drive from Bendigos CBD, Bendigo train station and the Calder Highway. First-class education, employment and shopping amenities are also nearby.

So, come and explore the perfect new lifestyle opportunity at Imagine Strathfieldsaye.

Description:
IMMACULATE, SOLID BRICK 80s BUILD
This solid brick family home is positioned midway between Eaglehawk and the centre of Bendigo. Walking distance to bus stops and sporting oval, and located in a peaceful, established street, this well-maintained, beautifully presented property was built in the early 1980s and features character details of the era, including the post-modernism façade.
The front garden is neat and tidy with a wide covered porch leading to the entry. The door opens into a formal lounge, and double doors from this room direct you into an open plan living, kitchen and dining space. Exposed brick walls, archways and a built-in bar add retro charm, and the spacious kitchen offers a more contemporary finish with recently updated appliances and plenty of storage.
The master bedroom can be found off the main living area on one side. This large room features split system heating and cooling and a ceiling fan. A sizeable walk-through wardrobe separates the bedroom from the ensuite. On the other side of the central living area are two remaining bedrooms, both with built-in robes. This section of the home also offers a family bathroom, separate toilet, and laundry with access to the rear of the house.
Glass sliding doors from the main living open out to a large alfresco area ideal for year-round entertaining. This space overlooks a fernery and to one side is a fenced utility area. To the other side of the house is a lawn area with garden bed, a garden shed and a fenced space with raised garden beds the perfect set up for a veggie patch.
Additional features include:
Split system heating and cooling throughout
Ceiling fans in all bedrooms
Gas wall heater in main living
Modern kitchen appliances including dishwasher, wall oven with separate grill and four-burner gas cooktop
Ample storage throughout
Garden shed
Access from both sides of the property into the rear garden
With bus stops, sporting oval and schools all within easy reach, this is potentially a fantastic starter home for a buyer wanting to step onto the property ladder with a house they can really make their own. Alternatively, this solid build is ideal for a rural downsizer seeking peace and quiet, space and a garden close to amenities.
Insights: 3 Shepperbottom Street, California Gully VIC 3556 was last sold in 2020 and 52 other 3 bedroom house in California Gully have recently been sold.

Description:
Rented until May 27 2021 - An Investors Dream
An Investors Dream
Rented at $360 per week till May 27 2021.
Taking in views over the 11th fairway of Neangar Park Golf club in a quiet street is this beautiful family home. Surrounded by quality homes and within a short stroll to public transport, daycare centers and sporting facilities this home will suit many families.
The house has four large bedrooms all with built in robes the main bedroom with walk in robe and ensuite. With a separate study nook and rumpus this home offers space for all. Year-round comfort with ducted heating and cooling throughout.
The kitchen is the center of this home with separate dinning and lounge areas that flow out to the low maintenance fully fenced rear yard. Just of the lounge is a large separate rumpus room which also has direct access to the rear yard. For the home cook the kitchen boasts stainless steel appliances, a large island bench and good-sized pantry. A well-positioned laundry with access to side yard and large walk in linen cupboard provide good storage.
Located close to two local primary schools and sporting oval this property is a must to inspect. The home is in a subdivision that is quiet and safe and would be the perfect place to raise a family or acquire a great investment property.
Inside Features:
Large main bedroom with walk in robe and ensuite
Two separate living areas
Study nook
Built in robes to remaining bedrooms
Ducted gas heating
Ducted evaporative air conditioning
Outside Features:
Double garage with auto door
Secure fencing
Low maintenance yard

Description:
Convenience & Comfort
Situated in a quiet no-through road sits 2 Tobin Crescent.
This freshly renovated family home has so much to offer, tied up in one neat package.
The first thing you will notice when you step inside is how beautifully sun-drenched the living space is. Warm and inviting, the main living zone wraps around to a meals area and stylish kitchen, with ample bench space and gas cooking.
From here you will step outside to the large undercover alfresco area, with built-in barbecue and provisions for a wall-mounted TV. Perfect for Friday night BBQ's watching the footy or cricket!
The low maintenance yard surrounds the property, with lock-up carport for 2 cars, additional shedding, and the ability to have side access for caravan or trailer should you require.
Back inside and 3 great size bedrooms all offer built-in robes, while the master has its own split system and access directly to the bathroom.
The location of this home is unsurpassed in Epsom, just 450 metres to the Epsom Train Station, 900 metres to Epsom Village and a 2-minute drive to Epsom Primary.
Sure to impress upon inspection. Contact Briohny Mitchell today.

Description:
Central Flora Hill Winner
Purchase your prime piece of real estate and continue to pour love into this charming, 2 bedroom home.
Set in a quiet nook of Flora Hill sits this sturdy and well-maintained property offering all the benefits of its location; central to both Strath Village one way, the Bendigo Marketplace the other and surrounded by parks, schools, day care, La Trobe University and public transport.
Refurbishing and updating would be idyllic with its floor plan and original fittings creating the perfect foundations to bring this abode into the modern era while still highlighting its character.
Entering the property you'll admire the well-manicured front yard and character of the front facade highlighting the '70s era.
Inside and off the front entry, walk through double sliding doors into your naturally lit large lounge room thanks to its floor to ceiling windows. This space also boasting an ornate tiled fireplace with gas heater and built-in decorative storage either side.
The open plan meals and kitchen area offers up plenty of space, storage options including a walk-in pantry plus freestanding oven, and has an ideal footprint to enable some fresh touches of your own.
Heating and ducted cooling, as well as ceiling fans make for all year round comfort.
A neat bright bathroom with bath, bedrooms with built-in robes, external security window fittings, shade awnings, and lock up single car garage all add to the highlights of this investment.
Outside, step out under your large entertaining patio and overlook the rest of the green back yard.
Located only 2kms to Bendigo CBD, the property is in an ideal location with potential for some fresh touches to make 8 Raymond Avenue, Flora Hill an ideal investment.
